summary: The 'Generating Resilient, Environmentally Exceptional National Streets Act' (GREEN Streets Act) amends U.S. Code Title 23 (Highways) and Title 49 (Transportation). Key provisions include requiring transportation planners to consider greenhouse gas emission reduction in projects. It establishes performance measures for public roads focusing on decreasing vehicle miles traveled, improving resilience, and reducing emissions, setting minimum standards for states.  It also mandates analysis of road capacity expansion projects, and strengthens transit accessibility standards and reporting. The bill aims to promote sustainable transportation and reduce the environmental impact of road infrastructure.
